author: jinfwhuang
content: After the merge, will devp2p still be used as the networking protocol for the execution layer?

author: djrtwo
content:
Yes

There is some desire to deprecate over time but execution layer sync and tx gossip will remain stable, at least at first

author: m.kalinin
content: Block gossip on the execution layer is deprecated by the merge and will be handled by the consensus layer, other than that no changes to devp2p are expected

author: tuyen4818
content: have we had any interop effort or any instructions on how to set up consensus/execution clients to interop?

author: m.kalinin
content: I guess client teams will publish docker images and instructions on how to run their clients. There is also a set of provision tools and respective guide that we used to run devnets during the Rayonism (https://github.com/protolambda/mergenet-tutorial), it should be updated as well
